Topic.Title: Gawd I hope ammzn does a green mountain coffee roasted:)

Message.Msg: Yes... that would be great, but it won't happen because wall street is in love with this company for some reason right now. It can do no wrong!! Management forecasted a loss for the next quarter, but the stock ran up from about $210 or so to where it is now since then. AMZN announce new kindles coming...stock goes up... they never say exactly how many are sold, but stock goes up.. Walmart decides not to sell Kindles any longer...stock does nothing... B&N announce a new Nook...AMZN stock does nothing....AAPL iPad mini coming soon...no effect on AMZN stock. The stock just never goes down because of the wall street favor that AMZN currently has...and the amount of $$$ the options bandits are making off the weekly options!! One day the downward pressure will start, but who knows when or what the catalyst will be.

Topic.Title: 2 new kindle killers by barnes comin out

Message.Msg: Yes, at least this tablet business has a lot of competition. Nook HD7 has its own advantage. Its lighter and has higher resolution, its processor is more powerful, and has SD slot. More than that. Now Amazon's cloud computing business faces tough competition from new players. IBM, Oracle, and HPQ all will come to steal some customers. Even for the best scenario Amazon can keep its existing customers, the growth rate in this business will be much much smaller than before because new comers are coming.

Message.Title: Bubble eventually will bust. With PE 300, growth rate is going down
Message.Msg: AMZN is a wonderful stock in the last 3-4 years. Now it faces tough competition with local retail business because its sales tax advantage is gone, and more retails also started doing online business. Its Kindle Fire business is losing money business. People get Kindle fire will not necessary buy stuff from Amazon because most of this type of consumers only want to get good deals. Amazon either has to make smaller profit to provide good deals to those people or cannot sell. It is on down trend now. It will go to $230-$235 before earning. If the earning is not good, it will go to $200 or even lower.

Topic.Title: Bought some calls.

Message.Msg: "please explain why it is obvious..." If you look at AMZN's 1-minutes chart for the last two days, you can clearly see two sharp sell-offs: one starting from around $254.29 at about 2:46 PM on the 25th (yesterday) and the other one starting around $251.03 at about 10:21 am today, My thesis is that all of these sharp (quick) sell-offs are engineered. In other words, somebody created them by actively dumping shares. As long as they don't do that tomorrow, the price has nowhere but to go back to the previous equilibrium points, which are approximately $251.25 and $252.46. I'm betting that $251 will be broken to the upside because most shorts here are assuming that at worst AMZN will bounce only up to $251.16 (today's high after the initial sharp sell-off). Obviously because they're stupid, they will be proven wrong. When $251 gets broken to the upside, $252.46 becomes the next resistance for them to watch for. Shorts here will be just watching again, so AMZN will climb to $252.46. Of course, shorts here won't cover around $252.46 either because they think that's solid resistance. So, again they will be proven wrong and when they see $253 being tested or violated, some will wet their pink panties and cover. If the general market gets strong tomorrow, AMZN will drift back up to $255.

Message.Title: Shorts, are you sad?

I was prepared to load up if the price of the calls I bought a little earlier went down, but the price firmed up towards the close (actually ended higher than my average purchase price). $256 tomorrow is within the realm of possibility. Topic.Title: Bought some calls.

Message.Msg: "if many shorts, especially weeklies, were entered after morning selloff then u could be right too. wonder if u followed those." You mean the opening action on every Thursday except the second of each month (when new Weeklys options become available)? I haven't done any careful study, but the price of AMZN often moves a couple or so points in two directions (up then followed by down or the opposite) right after the opening. I attribute these movements to option writers/market makers buying and shorting AMZN shares to counter options they write. So tomorrow's initial move will depend on which options will be more in demand, puts or calls. To tell you the truth, I have no idea. Oh, one more thing I noticed today. I'm pretty sure many shorts are expecting AMZN to drop one more time tomorrow and thinking they will cover then. And of course, when too many people expect something, they don't happen.

Topic.Title: Bought some calls.

Message.Msg: geegen: "My thesis is that all of these sharp (quick) sell-offs are engineered." No, its institutional selling. The institutions sell to brokers with instructions to unload xxx number of share by end of day. The brokers trade back and forth during the day, giving the illusion of support and then dump at the end of the day. The good news is that, based on a year ago's model, most of this correction is over. The bad news is that the next rally will see more selling.

Topic.Title: 1937 deja vu

Message.Msg: Don't stop there... October 1986 and in 2008...when was that again?? Sept/October maybe???

Topic.Title: 1937 deja vu

Message.Msg: That's why Ben preempted all of this, to minimize the panic. We won't see anything like that in the market at large, assuming institutions sell the scams to support the real investments. If they try to support the scams and let the real investments go, everything will fall and the impact on investor confidence is likely to be irreparable in the short to medium term.
